text: [Applause]
HBS women are ambitious
brilliant accomplished problem solvers
impactful determined sassy resilient
passionate leaders motivated competitive
tenacious and certainly the ones that
were there earlier are
pioneers for me success is all about
developing your entire person and
finding your passion and tending towards
the whole woman to be able to have you
success over time she doesn't have to
have it all at any given moment of time
but I want her to feel as though she can
have it all um through the course of her
life to me success in the 21st century
is
self-awareness so it's knowing what
you're good at and what you're
passionate about it's knowing what don't
like and what you're not good at and
it's the ability to carve out a life for
yourself that's optimized for you and so
if you want to run a company you can run
a company if you want to give back you
can give back if you want to have a
family you can do all of that so you can
still be a CEO and a super mom but you
can't be them at the exact same moment
and every moment of every day you've got
to make a
decision the first thing that you really
have to understand is what you really
want to do what your real passions are
the other thing that you have to
understand is that you're not going to
be able to do everything in this world
that you want to do at the same time
everybody thought okay we can do it all
we can have a job we can raise kids we
can be super women that was kind of the
message and if only you had the energy
and the smarts and the stick toess and
you weren't U overly influenced by
people who told you you could not do
things if you had a certain amount of uh
impetus to Buck the system and just stay
the course the steps that women should
be taking early on in their careers is
to think more about uh how family fits
into their careers um because we leave
Harvard Business School with these
incredibly lofty goals and this enormous
ambition um which are all great things
but at some point the reality of Life
comes up but but most of all stay secure
because you're professional job does not
define you uh you can be confident in
the knowledge that you're a smart and
capable confident person you don't need
a title to uh to make you a secure
person in this world just be happy in
your own skin the steps that women can
take early in their career to prepare
for the curves that life throws them I
would say have a plan but don't be
married to it I would say Follow Your
Passion rather than what you think is
the competitive thing to do or what's
going to make the most money think
longterm about your lifestyle and how
you want to live your life very very
often I think we get so caught up in our
careers and getting the tasks done that
we don't take time to pay attention to
the emotional
intelligence and to remember that
opportunities can come from all sorts of
different places I've had wonderful
things happen in my life from people I
wouldn't have expected so it's a good
idea to be nice to everybody and to
remember that your network of
relationships is really quite broad HBS
was the most interesting group of people
I ever saw in one place uh and it
changed my life in a number of ways
people will often ask
me why did you decide to go to Harvard
Business School because I never wanted
to hear the question can you type again
and people of women of my generation
were asked that question no matter what
their education no matter how much
travel and how much experience um I
graduated with honors from uh one of the
best colleges there were and I was asked
um can you type it's actually made me
more Fearless it's made me more
courageous and willing to seek out new
and different opportunities the impact
that HBS has had on my life is
immeasurable because I met my husband
the first day of class so out of a
thousand men I married Steven Bal whom
I've been married to for 44 years and
have two sons one of whom went to
Harvard and the other went to Harvard
Law School when I went to HBS I was the
single parent of a 2-year-old and
4-year-old I don't think anyone had ever
been a single parent at HBS before so
I've been told and I would say that by
going to
HBS and then into the careers that it
prepared me for I actually had more
flexibility and more
opportunity to manage my career career
at the same time as I stayed very
focused on my family than if I had not
gone to
HBS in terms of how Harvard Business
School has um impacted my life I would
say that one of the reasons that I went
was that I did not want anyone ever to
question my credentials I didn't want
anyone ever to say and this was the' 70s
you can't do that because you don't have
this or that degree so I thought that an
MBA from Harvard business school would
stop all questions right where they
started and they did it brought the
world closer it taught me about
economics for the first time and it gave
me friends all over the world HBS has
been a wonderful gateway to many
opportunities and many people and
therefore had tremendously positive
impact on my career and on my life in
general HBS enabled me to switch careers
become financially independent and learn
about many many businesses in the
context of being an investor when I left
the program I left the am program I'd
already been in an executive position
running a large division of a large
corporation and what I had learned
during the program I was really able to
readily apply my HPS experience has had
a tremendous impact on my life I would
say that it has given me the courage to
take risk and also it has provided me
with a Global Network of alumni many of
whom are very dear friends and others
who are very valuable colleagues and
part of my Professional Network it's
given me a systematic way to approach
business and the world and it's also
given me people all over the world that
I can visit Wherever I Go HBS is
credibility so it's really offered a lot
of opportunities in the business field
and uh lots of challenges is and um I'm
very thankful for that my HBS experience
has has been a gift to me it has given
me professional fulfillment and this is
something that I never thought I would
get but I have gotten it I think there's
a big difference in the kids who are who
are graduating Now versus when I was
there in 1978 and I can talk about this
firsthand because my son David Himel
happens to be a first year student at
Harvard Business School and what fun it
is to see the school through his eyes
almost 34 years after I graduated all
decades all ages all experience and and
they're just they're awesome they
they're motivated they know how to hit
the ground running they don't have a lot
of baggage about how to get things done
and it's been a pleasure I I think that
what's different now about than when we
graduated was that there were so few
women for us there were only perhaps uh
I think 29 or 28 women in my class two
or three per section so we didn't have a
lot of people that we could lean on and
all the women were also relatively
inexperienced in the business world so
we couldn't really help one another
terribly much with getting the
experience space that we needed to do
well I think the major difference for
women graduating today versus when I
graduated in
1983 is that there are many more
professional women now than when I
graduated the younger generation has the
internet and with the social media
digital marketing during that time when
we began we only had three women out of
160 men my friendships and connections
with HBS women have been the most
inspiring friendships that I've had uh
and I feel like HBS women are so Dynamic
so passionate about what they do and at
the end of the day Fearless take
advantage of every moment every inch of
space that you have while you are in
those walls and make it work and make it
Rock for you the network is
extraordinary the work we do together as
a community is incredible both
professionally as well as in our
philanthropic Endeavors as my career has
moved me from New York to San Francisco
and even Sydney Australia the HBS Alumni
network has been a big help to me I
found that working with the alumni clubs
around the world has helped me tap into
the Alumni network in important ways
it's helped me to assimilate to new
communities to make important business
contacts and also lifelong friends stay
connected with your classmates with any
women with any people from your HBS
Network because they are such a powerful
Network there's so many open doors that
can can happen for you as a result of
meeting and and connecting with the
people that are from HBS now that uh
women have a a broader role in business
we it's easy to forget and I think it
was easy for my class to forget the
women that came before us and as I got
to be a more senior person in my career
I realized there were fewer and fewer
women around and they became my friends
my female friends from HBS became a much
more important part of my life I'd
always been friends with them but I
began to look at them more as advisers
to me in my my career for their help for
their advice for their suggestions
because when we help somebody else it's
a great reminder that we have value and
it's very it's very easy when we're
looking and we're asking people for help
whether it's finding a job that we don't
necessarily feel as good about ourselves
as we should and by helping other people
and acting as a connector for them it's
a great way of feeling empowered and
helpful and powerful and confident
[Music]
